## matched 
http://www.sthda.com/english/articles/35-statistical-machine-learning-essentials/141-cart-model-decision-tree-essentials/

### tree 1
```{r }
set.seed(124)
model <-train(case ~ ., 
                  data=data, method="rpart",
                  trControl = trainControl("cv", number = 5),
                  maxdepth= 5)
  
print(model)
model$finalModel
# Plot the final tree model
try(par(xpd = NA)) # Avoid clipping the text in some device
try(plot(model$finalModel))
try(text(model$finalModel,  digits = 3,cex=0.7))

try(rpart.plot(model$finalModel))

```

```{r eval=FALSE, include=FALSE}
library(rpart)
rf.model<- rpart(
  case ~ ., 
  data = data, 
  method = "class"
 # minsplit = 2,  minbucket = 1
  )

print(rf.model)
par(xpd = NA)
plot(rf.model)
text(rf.model,  digits = 3)
```


```{r eval=FALSE, include=FALSE}
rf.model <- randomForest(formula = case ~ ., data = data, 
                           replace = TRUE,
                           ntree =  1,
                           sampsize = round(nrow(data)*0.6),
                           nodesize = 1 ,
                           mtry = sqrt(ncol(data)-1)
                          )
  print(rf.model)
  getTree(rf.model, k=1, labelVar=TRUE)

```
